forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain after 10pm. Mostly cloudy. Low around 52, with temperatures rising to around 54 overnight. South wind 10 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 29 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 57 in the afternoon. South wind 18 to 26 mph, with gusts as high as 39 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a half and three quarters of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As twilight drapes itself softly over Downtown San Francisco, the air carries a cool, damp promise of rain. Through the dimming light, the cityscape is cloaked in a veil of moist clouds, reducing visibility and transforming familiar landmarks into shadowy impressions. Tonight, the warmth of the day slips away, with temperatures lingering around the low fiftys, while a brisk south wind rustles through the streets, stirring leaves and creating an atmosphere both alive and expectant. With a 90% chance of precipitation looming, it feels as if the clouds are preparing to release their bounty soon; drizzles may begin as early as ten o'clock.

The forecast for Wednesday reveals a continuation of this damp theme, with rain expected to persist through the day. The sky will remain a canvas of gray, casting a muted palette over the city. Highs will hover around fifty-nine, cooling by afternoon, as the relentless south winds pick up strength. In such weather, a comfortable jacket layered over a light sweater would be wise, along with sturdy footwear for navigating slippery streets. As this evening unfolds and the rain begins, perhaps cozy indoor activities beckon—a visit to a local bookstore, where the scent of coffee mingles with the pages, or perhaps curling up with a film that mirrors the pensive mood of the night. Whether seeking solace indoors or venturing out into the refreshing rain, one cannot deny the allure of a city wrapped in its own foggy embrace.
